full_text: Screened by NARA 7/26/2023 UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE P.O. Box 82521 Lincoln, Nebraska 68501-2521 Date: August 17, 1998 Refiles Refer to File No. AHMED H. OMAR 3681 N DECATUR RD APT 15 485 DECATUR GA 30032- 06/26/98 LIN-98-188-52770 LINLXN01 REQUEST FOR EVIDENCE THE INITIAL DOCUMENTATION SUBMITTED WITH YOUR FORM I-131, (Application for Travel Document), IS NOT SUFFICIENT TO WARRANT FAVORABLE CONSIDERATION OF YOUR APPLICATION. Submittal of the following items and/or additional information will assist in the processing of your application. Please submit or comply with the items checked below: 1. If you are a lawful permanent resident or conditional resident, you must submit documentation verifying your status. To be accepted as evidence, the documentation must clearly show your status, provide your biographic information, and must include your photo. Any of the following may be accepted as evidence of your lawful permanent or conditional resident status: I. A photocopy of your I-551, Alien Registration Card (ARC), showing both the back and front sides, as proof of your status as a lawful permanent or conditional resident of the United States. The copies must clearly show your photograph and card information. II. If you have not received your Alien Registration Card, submit a copy of the biographic page, and the page of your passport indicating initial admission as a permanent or conditional resident, or other evidence that you are a permanent or conditional resident. Or, III. A copy of the approval notice of a separate application for replacement of your alien registration card or temporary evidence of permanent or conditional resident status. (131E. A) 2. Submit evidence that you qualify as a refugee for the purpose of issuance of a refugee travel document. To qualify, you must have been admitted, paroled, or granted status in the United States as a refugee or an asylee, or you must have been admitted or adjusted to lawful permanent resident status based on a refugee or asylee claim. You must submit a photocopy of your I-94 card, your I-551 or card (both front and back, which clearly shows the photo and identity information) or other documentation to show that you have been granted a status making you eligible for a refugee travel document. If you do not have an alien registration card you must submit a copy of your Form I-94 along with a copy of a photo identity document such as a passport, a driver's license, or another document showing your photo, your name and date of birth. The identity document copy must clearly show the photograph and identity information. (131J) 3. Since becoming a Permanent Resident (or during the past five years, whichever is less), how much total time have you spent outside the United states? Have not been outside the U.S. 1 to 2 years during the mentioned time period 2 to 3 years less than 6 months 3 to 4 years 6 months to 1 year more than 4 years (CONTINUED ON REVERSE SIDE)
